summary: This bill, the DHS Special Events Program and Support Act, amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to authorize a program within the Department of Homeland Security to assess the threat, vulnerability, and consequences of terrorism or other security threats at certain special events. The program will provide support to federal, state, local, tribal, and territorial officials. The bill mandates annual reports to Congress and requires research on technologies for enhancing security at mass gatherings. It also makes a clerical amendment to the Homeland Security Act's table of contents.
